page.title: 01DRUMNADROCHIT-GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: {Drumnadrochit}is on the North side of {Loch Ness}where{Glenurquhart}meets the {Great Glen.}It is 15 miles from {Inverness}and originally developed as a bridging point of the river{Enrick. The village lies on the valley bottom with hills to the North and Southwest. {Glenurquhart}runs from East to West. {Drumnadrochit}is also a route centre with the A82 from Inverness to Fort Augustus passing through it and the A831 going to Cannich. Most of the people who live in{Drumna- {drochit}and the nearby villages of {Milton}and{Lewiston} work in the village or commute to Inverness.Though there are also a number of retired people. The area has warm summers(15'C) and cool winters(1'C),which are slightly warmed by the waters of the loch. Rainfall generally averages 1000mm.
